channel.title: Mousemap on Jente Hidskes' personal website
channel.description: Recent content in Mousemap on Jente Hidskes' personal website

item.title: GSoC part 7: the resolutions stack page
item.description: This week was a good week with loads of progress. I’ll just go through each item one by one, as usual. MouseMap merged Last Friday I opened the pull request to merge the MouseMap widget. After a bit of a discussion around preferences, my mentor and I decided to merge ongoing work in a rewrite branch. This keeps the master branch functional (while still receiving improvements, such as adding new functionality to the ratbagd bindings or a Gtk.

item.title: GSoC part 6: progress!
item.description: This week Piper saw some progress again! Today I opened the pull request for the MouseMap that I’ve been working on for the past two and a half weeks now. I’ll discuss the changes made since the last blog later; first, I want to highlight the other work I did the past week. A major milestone this week is the merging of ratbagd and libratbag. While Piper shouldn’t notice any of this (it talks to ratbagd over DBus), it’s still a highlight I want to mention.

item.title: GSoC part 5: exams
item.description: As mentioned in my previous blog, the X.Org Foundation now wants us to blog every week. Whilst that means shorter blogs (last week’s was a tad long), it also means that there isn’t much to blog about if I didn’t do much in a week. Such is the case for this week, sadly. It’s the last week of university, and so there are a few assignment deadlines that I needed to complete; I haven’t been able to invest as much time into my project as I would have wanted.

item.title: GSoC part 4: the first sprint
item.description: This is going to be a long one, so grab a drink and a snack and buckle up! Incidentally, the X.Org foundation has asked us, the 2017 GSoC students, to blog weekly so from now on I will do so; which will also mean smaller blogs in the future. I made a schedule to go with my proposal in which I divided the coding period into two week sprints to plan out my project.
